ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Patch Message
ygData.msgSnippet: Well as to a /w all bard count... i have a couple comments First, bards are one of the fashionable twinks right now, just like sks and pallies.. because of the
ygData.messageBody:
Well as to a /w all bard count... i have a couple comments

First, bards are one of the fashionable twinks right now, just like sks and
pallies.. because of the xp patch in part i'm sure ... but I also notice
these things go in waves. before this it was rogues.. and then warriors
before that .. and chanters. I'm betting on mages being in the next go
round. Bards are fairly easy to twink equipment wise as well, which is
appealing to a lot of people.

Second, bards are a lot more challenging (even twinked) than most people
know and I dont believe most of those twinks will make it past level 30.

But I could be way off base :)

Halana/Tani

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Christopher Sanders [mailto:christopher.sanders@...]
> Sent: Monday, February 26, 2001 10:25 AM
> To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Patch Message
>
>
> On Xegony, before the xp patch, a /w all bard count would net
> 30-40. That's
> high end, during prime time, etc.
>
> Yesterday afternoon, around 4pm or so EST, the count was 74.
>
> I know, I know, hardly scientific or anything, just an
> observation I've
> made.
>
> Atonal
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jeffrey Sue [mailto:jsue@...]
> Sent: Monday, February 26, 2001 12:35 PM
> To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Patch Message
>
>
> ok, how many people out of the total subscribers play bards?
> by the numbers
> posted here, less than 5%. by your argument, then bards and
> their issues
> are
> insignificant because less than 5% of the people who play
> everquest are
> affected.
>
> it's only insignificant if you're not the one it's affecting.
>
>
>

> >
> > >and you can't really discount pvp, it is a part of the game.
